title: Creamy Smoked Salmon Pasta Recipe
description: This smoked salmon pasta features chopped smoked salmon in a creamy Romano cheese sauce with peas and mushrooms for a satisfying weeknight dinner.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Seafood Fish Salmon Smoked Creamy Smoked Salmon Pasta 4.2 (250) 187 Reviews 29 Photos This smoked salmon pasta is a lighter version of pasta carbonara. For people who want the flavor but not the bacon, smoked salmon is the perfect substitute! Submitted by Dinah Updated on October 6, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 29 29 29 29 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (16 ounce) package penne pasta 6 tablespoons butter ½ onion, finely chopped 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 2 teaspoons garlic powder 2 cups skim milk ½ cup grated Romano cheese 1 cup frozen green peas, thawed and drained ½ cup canned mushrooms, drained 10 ounces smoked salmon, chopped Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add penne and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes; drain. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion in butter until tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir flour and garlic powder into onion. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Gradually stir in milk. Heat to just below boiling point, then gradually stir in cheese until sauce is smooth. Stir in peas and mushrooms; cook over low heat until warmed through, about 4 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Toss in smoked salmon and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes. Serve over pasta. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 399 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 398 Calories 14g Fat 50g Carbs 20g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 398 % Daily Value * Total Fat 14g 18% Saturated Fat 7g 37% Cholesterol 40mg 13% Sodium 520mg 23% Total Carbohydrate 50g 18% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 7g Protein 20g 40% Vitamin C 4mg 4% Calcium 181mg 14% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 333mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Creamy Smoked Salmon Pasta 01 of 29 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 29 Photo by  patricia Robertson 12/29/2020 I made this dish exactly as the recipe dictates. The sauce was very creamy and delicious. I love that Allrecipes allows me to select the numbers of servings I want to make and presto, the quantities readjust. I was actually surprised at how delicious this turned out. 03 of 29 Photo by  pcurrer 02/17/2020 Great flavor and an easy to make meal, I used fresh pasta so everything cooked in about 8 minutes. I think a bit less flower, the sauce was a bit dry for coating the pasta. 04 of 29 Photo by  Briana Ray-Williams 06/20/2019 05 of 29 Photo by  Ramboette 06/06/2019 06 of 29 Photo by  Vanessa Martens 05/02/2019 07 of 29 Photo by  Mark Johnson 03/24/2019 Very tasty good! I'm glad I picked this recipe for the smoked salmon I had. I used 2% milk, and Parmesan cheese... the peas and mushrooms are a good addition to this dish. I think fresh mushrooms would be even better. 08 of 29 Photo by  Crissy Anne 02/01/2019 09 of 29 Photo by  Oshun 01/04/2019 It was delicious by I did alter the original recipe.instead of skim milk I used heavy whipping cream; instead of penned pasta I used bow tie pasta; and instead of peas I used fresh baby spinach. I added two cloves of garlic, garnished with cracked pepper and scallions 10 of 29 Photo by  Shaun Medina 05/14/2018 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Creamy Vodka Fettuccine with Tomato, Smoked Salmon, and Caviar 2 Ratings Salmon and Spinach Fettuccine 197 Ratings Smoked Salmon Pizza 22 Ratings Smoked Salmon Pesto Pasta 80 Ratings Smoked Salmon Dill Eggs Benedict 51 Ratings Smoked Salmon Pasta with Scotch 36 Ratings Baked Lemon-Butter Salmon with Pasta 6 Ratings Lemon-Pepper Salmon 209 Ratings Seaside Pasta with Vegetables 6 Ratings New Year Spinach Fettuccine with Scallops 65 Ratings Smoked Salmon Mac and Cheese Salmon and Chive Tea Sandwiches 1 Rating Chicken Milano 2,812 Ratings Yummy Lemon Salmon Burgers 420 Ratings Fettucine with Heavenly Salmon Sauce 49 Ratings Pasta with Scallops, Zucchini, and Tomatoes 424 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
